I'd highly recommend watching "Spider-Man 2" if you're a fan of Peter Parker. This action-packed movie features Tobey Maguire as Spider-Man, battling his former mentor, the villainous Doctor Octopus, played by Alfred Molina. It's a thrilling tale that showcases both the personal and superhero life of our favorite web-slinger!

If you're interested in a more historical and introspective take on Peter, "That Summer" might be an intriguing choice for you. This documentary follows Peter Beard as he reminisces about his past, including his childhood in East Hampton, with appearances from Lee Radziwill, the younger sister of Jacqueline Kennedy Onassis.

This action-packed movie follows Peter Parker as he navigates his dual life as an ordinary high school student and a crime-fighting superhero, Spider-Man. You'll enjoy seeing Tobey Maguire portray the iconic character, while J.K. Simmons delivers a memorable performance as J. Jonah Jameson. It's filled with suspenseful moments, humor, and heart, making it an excellent choice for both comic book fans and newcomers alike!

This film is set during World War II and follows a man who goes to extreme lengths to be declared insane and avoid combat duties. Another interesting option might be "Amen.", a drama that delves into the darker aspects of the war and the efforts made by a priest to inform Pope Pius XII about Jewish extermination camps. Both films are thought-provoking and feature engaging narratives. Enjoy your movie time!

Another movie you might find intriguing is "Eve's Bayou", which offers a darker, gothic twist with its exploration of secrets and mystical forces within an affluent family in the deep south. Given that you mentioned a fondness for 'Proof of Life' and the genre seems to lean towards war films, I'd recommend watching "Black Hawk Down". This gripping film takes an in-depth look at the US intervention in Somalia, featuring a star-studded cast including Ewan McGregor, Josh Hartnett, and Orlando Bloom.

If you fancy something a bit different from that war genre, but still by Peter Hedges who wrote "Proof of Life", I'd suggest giving "Flags of Our Fathers" a watch. This film tells the true story of the six men who raised the flag at Iwo Jima during World War II, starring stars like Ryan Phillippe and Paul Walker. Enjoy your movie time!

Tom Hulce might not be in it, but the voice cast is star-studded, featuring John Ratzenberger and James Coburn among others.

Denzel Washington delivers a powerful performance in this gritty and compelling film.

I'd highly recommend "American Sniper" for you. This movie, starring Tom Hulce alongside Bradley Cooper, tells a powerful story about Navy SEAL Chris Kyle who, with his unparalleled sniping skills, saves countless lives on the battlefield. However, transitioning back to civilian life proves challenging as the war he fought continues to haunt him.

If you're interested in a slightly different genre, "Stranger than Fiction" might pique your curiosity. This unique film, also featuring Tom Hulce, explores the strange phenomenon of a mundane IRS auditor hearing his own life being narrated by an unseen voice, affecting every aspect of his existence.

Based on your preferences for a war genre movie with a deeper emotional tone, I'd recommend "In the Land of Blood and Honey" (2011). Directed by Angelina Jolie and featuring Branko Djuric and Jelena Jovanova, this film explores complex relationships in the midst of the Bosnian War.

Another movie that might interest you is "Inglourious Basterds" (2009) directed by Quentin Tarantino. With an ensemble cast including Brad Pitt, Christoph Waltz, and Samuel L. Jackson, this film offers a unique take on World War II with elements of revenge and suspense. Both movies provide compelling narratives that delve into the human condition amidst war.
